meanings.sent1: My brother can be a real bullhead when he refuses to admit he's wrong.
meanings.sent2: The bullhead refused to change his mind, no matter what anyone said.
meanings.sent3: The bullhead at the meeting wouldn't budge an inch on his opinion, even when presented with new facts.
meanings.sent4: She's as stubborn as a bullhead when it comes to sticking to her schedule.
meanings.sent5: His bullhead attitude caused him to miss out on many opportunities for compromise.

meanings.definition: A type of freshwater fish with a large head and a wide mouth.
meanings.sent1: We caught a big bullhead while fishing at the lake yesterday.
meanings.sent2: The bullhead swam lazily in the pond, waiting for its next meal.
meanings.sent3: The bullhead fish looked like it was wearing a permanent frown with its downturned mouth.
meanings.sent4: The bullhead's head was so large, it seemed almost comical compared to its small body.
meanings.sent5: The bullhead's wide mouth made it easy for it to catch prey in the murky waters.

meanings.definition: A type of nail with a large, flat head.
meanings.sent1: He hammered the bullhead into the wood to secure the loose board.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter used a bullhead to attach the trim to the door frame.
meanings.sent3: The bullhead nail stood out from the rest due to its distinctive flat top.
meanings.sent4: The bullhead nail sat proudly atop the wooden beam, holding everything together.
meanings.sent5: The bullhead nail's large head prevented it from sinking too deeply into the surface.
